examples: I love to eat apples with peanut butter.
She baked an apple pie for dessert.
The teacher used an apple to demonstrate gravity.
Eu adoro comer maçãs com manteiga de amendoim.
Ela assou uma torta de maçã para a sobremesa.
O professor usou uma maçã para demonstrar a gravidade.

suggested: Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything 'apple'! (A play on the phrase 'apple pie', of course.)
The thought of a world without fresh produce or access to healthy food options 'apple' can be disheartening.
It's frustrating when people take a bite out of our food without asking, especially if it's an 'apple' we were looking forward to.
Did you know that the word 'apple' can be used to describe a type of fruit, a symbol of knowledge, or a technology company?
The scent of a freshly picked 'apple' can be crisp and refreshing.
The physical sensation of holding and biting into an 'apple' can be a sign of satisfaction and nourishment.
The concept of 'apple' can be connected to the idea of growth, knowledge, and innovation.
